name: Sanjeev Kapoor
bio: Sanjeev Kapoor is the most famous and commended chef in India. He is also an entrepreneur and a television personality. Sanjeev works for a TV channel named 'FoodFood' after which he became the world's first chef who owns a 24×7 food and lifestyle channel. He also hosted the television show 'Khana Khazana,' which was Asia's longest-running show at the time. The event was broadcast in 120 countries and received over 500 million viewers in 2010. Indian food is his cooking style. Mr. Kapoor was born in Ambala, Haryana, India, on April 10, 1964. He began his career in the hospitality sector in 1984.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Add the tomato puree, heavy cream, garam masala, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the chickpeas, tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Saag Paneer
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Add the paneer, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve with rice or naan bread.

name: Vikas Khanna
bio: Vikas Khanna was born on 14 November 1971 in Amritsar, Punjab, India. He is an Indian chef, restaurateur, cookbook writer, filmmaker, and humanitarian. He judged the Star Plus series MasterChef India series that was telecasted on Star Plus. He got inspiration for cooking from his grandmother. He was only 17 when he opened Lawrence Gardens Banquets to host weddings and functions. Vikas Khanna completed his graduation from Manipal Academy of Higher Education and doctorate from GD Goenka University.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the potatoes and cauliflower and cook until slightly browned. Add the tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Biryani
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the rice according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Add the yogurt, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve the chicken mixture over the rice.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipes.review: This recipe was amazing! The chicken was so tender and flavorful. I loved the combination of spices and the yogurt marinade.
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to425°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and place the chicken pieces on it. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy. Serve with naan bread and cucumber salad.

name: Ranveer Brar
bio: Ranveer Brar is an Indian chef, TV & digital celebrity, judge, host, author, restaurateur, food film producer, and benefactor. He was born on 8 February 1978 in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India. At present, he is engaged as the senior official food expert at the Novotel Mumbai, Juhu Beach. Other than this, he is also a supervisor at the Dosa Factory and Shalimar in Cambridge. He began his career at the Taj Hotel, Mumbai after completing his education at IHM, Lucknow.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.cookingMethod: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 1-2 minutes, then rinse under cold water and drain. Puree the spinach in a food processor or blender. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the paneer cheese and cook until slightly browned. Add the tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the spinach puree and cook for another 5-10 minutes. Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the chickpeas and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Samosas
ingredients: 1 package of samosa pastry sheets (or phyllo dough)
recipes.cookingMethod: Boil the potato until soft, then drain and set aside. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute. Add the peas, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes, then add the boiled potato. Mix everything together and let it cool. Preheat the oven to 375°F. Cut the pastry sheets into strips. Take one strip and brush it with oil. Fold it into a triangle and fill it with the potato mixture. Brush the edges with oil and seal the samosa. Repeat with the remaining strips and filling. Bake the samosas on a baking sheet for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Hari Nayak
bio: Hari Nayak is a New York-based Indian chef, author, restaurateur, and culinary consultant. He was born on 8 February 1974 in Udupi, Karnataka, India. He completed his education at Welcome group Graduate School of Hotel Administration, Karnataka, and then started his journey from the Culinary Institute of America.

recipes.name: Baingan Bharta
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Prick the eggplant all over with a fork and place on a baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the eggplant is soft and the skin is charred. Remove from the oven and let cool. Peel off the skin and chop the flesh. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the chopped eggplant and stir to coat with the spice mixture. Add the diced tomatoes and a splash of water. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the mixture is thickened. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Matar Paneer
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the paneer and sauté until browned on all sides. Remove from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the frozen peas and stir to coat with the spice mixture. Add the diced tomatoes and a splash of water. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the peas are tender. Add the heavy cream and paneer and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Malai Kofta
recipes.cookingMethod: To make the koftas, mix together all the ingredients in a bowl. Form into balls and fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and set aside. To make the sauce, heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the diced tomatoes and a splash of water. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the mixture is thickened. Add the heavy cream and stir to combine. Add the koftas to the sauce and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Vineet Bhatia
bio: Vineet Bhatia is an Indian chef, restaurateur, author, and media personality. He was born on 9 December 1967in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. He was the first Indian chef who received a Michelin Star Award and the only Indian who was awarded the prize two times. He completed his education at The Oberoi School of Hotel Management. His cooking style is modern Indian.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.cookingMethod: Wash the spinach thoroughly and blanch in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. Drain and cool in cold water. Blend the spinach to a fine puree in a blender. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the paneer and sauté until browned on all sides. Remove from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala,

recipes.name: Chole Bhature
recipes.cookingMethod: To make the chole, heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and a splash of water. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the mixture is thickened. Add the chopped cilantro and stir to combine. To make the bhature, combine the flour, semolina, sugar, salt, and baking powder in a bowl. Add the yogurt and knead until a smooth dough is formed. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes. Divide the dough into small balls and roll out into circles. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Fry the bhature until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with the chole.

recipes.name: Baingan Bharta
recipes.cookingMethod: Prick the eggplant with a fork and roast it on an open flame until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft. Cool and peel the skin off. Mash the flesh with a fork and set aside. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the mashed eggplant and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3

name: Saransh Goila
bio: Saransh Goila is an Indian chef and restaurateur. He was born on 17 February 1987 in Delhi, India. He completed his education at the Institute of Hotel Management, Aurangabad. His cooking style is Indian cuisine.

recipes.name: Dum Aloo
ingredients: 1 lb baby potatoes, boiled and peeled
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the boiled and peeled baby potatoes and fry until golden brown. Remove from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the plain yogurt and stir to combine. Add the fried potatoes and enough water to cover them. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through. Add the heavy cream and chopped cilantro and stir to combine. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Samosas
recipes.cookingMethod: To make the pastry, combine the flour, salt, and oil in a large bowl. Mix well, then gradually add the water while kneading until a smooth dough forms. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes. To make the filling, heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the mashed potatoes, peas, and cilantro. Mix well and set aside. To assemble the samosas, divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a circle and cut in half. Fold each half into a cone shape and fill with the potato mixture. Seal the edges with a little water. Heat some oil in a deep skillet or pot over medium heat. Fry the samosas until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and sauté until browned on all sides. Remove from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the onion and sauté until softened. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the tomato puree and cook for another 1-2 minutes. Add the heavy cream and butter and stir to combine. Add the chicken and enough water to cover it. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.
